result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Jerome Ball was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Counts three and four.

Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   
AS to count 1:     The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 37 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 7 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 13 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid in counts 3 and 4 from cash bail on deposit and if balance owing during extended supervision or a civil judgment to be entered.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
AS to count 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with count 1, with credit for 7 days time served.  
AS to count 4:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with counts 1 and 3, with credit for 7 days time served.
Court orders that all costs, assessments and surcharges are to be taken from cash bail on deposit, and if balance owing to be paid during extended supervision in count 1 or a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant remanded.
Filed: Written explanation of determinate sentence, Pretrial credit, CR233

Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #1, #3 and Amended COUNT #4: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-21-2015 at 8:15 am.  Presentence Report requested by defense counsel.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 7-20-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.   mld

Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #4 to Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 946.41(1), a Class A Midemeanor."   mld

Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial:  Cases 2015CF380 and 2015CF1508.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-25-2015 at 8:30 am and case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 7-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

All conditions of bail are continued, until further order of the Court.  mld

Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Jerry Jerome Ball in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defense moves to dismiss Count 1 for lack of probable cause.  No argument by State.  Court grants request and orders Count 1 dismissed without prejudice.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
